image.altText: Gabriele Cairo and wife

props.synopsis: Italian tourist Gabriele Cairo, who was driving a campervan in regional SA when he caused a crash that left a woman and her parents dead, is handed a suspended sentence over what the judge described as a "true tragedy for everyone involved".

title.children: Italian tourist who killed three people in crash handed suspended sentence over 'true tragedy'

image.altText: A man standing in front of vine leaves making a gesture with his hands on top of each other

props.synopsis: The fatal stabbing of Ngor Bol in Adelaide's CBD has prompted members of the victim's family to move back to their home countries because they no longer feel safe in Australia, a court has heard.

title.children: Murder of young man slain by 'truly evil' killers prompts family to leave Australia for safety reasons, court told

image.altText: A woman bends down in a wide salt lake with a spoon and blue ice cream container

props.synopsis: With a spoon and an ice-cream container this sheep and salt farmer harvests in her own backyard.

title.children: How a salt lake considered a 'waste of country' became a business opportunity

image.altText: Natasha Stott Despoja at South Australia's Royal Commission into Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence.

props.synopsis: A royal commission has heard a lack of services vital to collecting evidence of sexual assault in regional South Australia has resulted in some victim-survivors walking away from potential prosecutions of perpetrators.

title.children: Sexual assault victim-survivors had to travel long distance for medical examinations, royal commission hears

image.altText: A man wearing a blue shirt holds a glass beaker full of water in front of his face.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide-based aquaculture company hopes to use saline groundwater to grow the products at a landlocked site in South Australia's Riverland.

title.children: Ocean fish and seaweed to be farmed hundreds of kilometres inland using salt water from deep underground

image.altText: Headshot of 15yo boy Elliott Senior wearing a halo neck and back brace

props.synopsis: Since the beginning of October, 14 children have presented to South Australia's Women's and Children's Hospital with mountain bike injuries – some of them life threatening.

title.children: 'Never seen anything like it': Surge in number of mountain bike injuries at Adelaide hospital prompts warning from authorities

image.altText: A baby sits against a white background smiling wearing a white shirt and flowery pants

props.synopsis: An inquest has heard that a father who killed his baby daughter in a murder-suicide near the Barossa, north of Adelaide, manipulated his ex-partner to drop domestic violence charges by deceiving the prison he was being held in.

title.children: Man who killed baby daughter in murder-suicide deceived a prison to manipulate his ex-partner

image.altText: Lauren poses for a photo in a garden wearing a pink dress

props.synopsis: Lauren Ash had been considering weight loss surgery when she heard about a friend taking Ozempic. She says the weight loss has improved her life, but there have been some challenges.

title.children: 'My food noise disappeared': How taking Ozempic has changed life for Lauren

image.altText: Side-by-side photos of Bianca Jones and Holly Bowles, two Melbourne teens who have been hospitalised in Thailand

props.synopsis: Holly Bowles, 19, remains on life support with methanol poisoning in Laos after an incident that claimed the life of her friend Bianca Jones. Meanwhile, their football club in Melbourne is rallying to support their families.

title.children: Laos methanol poisoning death toll reaches five, as Melbourne teenager Holly Bowles fights for life

image.altText: Man in suit at steps of Parliament House

props.synopsis: The station announces its 2025 line-up, with Spence Denny to present Evenings, and ABC political reporter Rory McClaren to fill the role of David Bevan after he retires in December.

title.children: New schedules for familiar voices and Rory McClaren to refresh ABC Radio Adelaide's line-up in 2025

image.altText: A phone displaying the meta logo sits on a computer keyboard

props.synopsis: The organisation — which owns Instagram and Facebook — says it will respect any age limits but believes the bill is being rushed without "adequate consultation or evidence". Follow live.

title.children: Meta says social media ban for under 16s is 'out of step' with research

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Greens' opposition of mis and disinformation bill 'kills it off': Sarah Hanson-Young
Greens to oppose mis and disinformation bill
Health Minister says he's 'very concerned' about Healthscope situation

image.altText: Joshy Schuetz in a hospital bed, head wrapped in bandages.

props.synopsis: The eight-year-old is in an induced coma after the quad bike he was on overturned on near Ubud, in Bali's central region.

title.children: Perth 8-year-old boy seriously injured in Bali quad bike crash to fly home in induced coma

image.altText: Tony wears a dark green cap, red polo and grey hoodie and sits in a chair with his kitchen behind him looking out the window

props.synopsis: Tenants in two capital cities are paying more than 30 per cent of their income, on average, towards their rent — for the first time since the SGS Economics Rental Affordability Index was first published a decade ago.

title.children: Rental affordability worst on record, costing more than 30pc of incomes in Sydney, Perth

image.altText: Mitchell Starc appeals for a wicket while KL Rahul looks on concerned

props.synopsis: Australia and India step onto the stage for their highly anticipated five-Test series, kicking off the action at Perth Stadium. Follow all the action in our live blog.

title.children: Indian star fumes at controversial DRS call as Australia takes control on day one in Perth

image.altText: A stock market board shows prices going up

props.synopsis: Local shares are set to end the week on a positive note, while Bitcoin closes in on $US100,000. Coles executives are grilled on supplier deals and WiseTech shares fall after its annual meeting. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX climbs as bitcoin hits fresh records, Coles faces supermarket inquiry, WishTech slumps

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: A happy Friday for the ASX
Adore Beauty sets its sights on Mecca and Sephora

image.altText: Mr Adani sits at a desk gesuring with his hands.

props.synopsis: American authorities have charged Indian billionaire Gautam Adani over his role in an alleged multi-billion-dollar scheme of bribery and fraud.

title.children: How Indian billionaire Gautam Adani's alleged bribery scheme took off and unraveled

image.altText: a man in a suit standing, and looking on, surrounded by bright lights

props.synopsis: The former Florida congressman denies allegations of sexual misconduct, but says his nomination was "unfairly becoming a distraction to the critical work of the Trump/Vance transition".

title.children: Donald Trump's choice for US attorney-general, Matt Gaetz, withdraws from consideration

image.altText: A court sketch of a woman with dark skin in a suit wearing handcuffs.

props.synopsis: A Perth grandmother alleging a romance scammer tricked her into trafficking drugs to Japan tells her criminal trial she did not suspect she was being tricked because she was never asked for money.

title.children: Perth grandmother tells trial she was tricked into carrying suitcase of drugs into Japan

image.altText: a woman with blonde hair looking serious

props.synopsis: Women are the fastest growing cohort of prisoners in the NT. But with domestic violence one of the main drivers of female offending, some experts say many of the women being locked up, shouldn't be behind bars at all.

title.children: Women in prison 'forgotten' in national conversation on domestic and family violence, advocates say

image.altText: Judge in robes.

props.synopsis: A District Court judge has criticised a lack of government funding for the state's courts and the long waiting times for trials while hearing an accused a man's bail application.

title.children: Judge lashes NSW over 'troubling' court backlogs causing two-year waits for trial

image.altText: Katy Perry smiles in a crystal stripes and stars bikini top, in a make up look resembling Rosie the Riveter.

props.synopsis: A string of legal action was first launched in June 2009 over a trademark held by Katie Jane Taylor, who uses her birth name to design and sell clothes under the brand Katie Perry.

title.children: Katy Perry defeats Sydney fashion designer in federal court following 13-year-long battle

image.altText: Richard Marles in Question Time

props.synopsis: Despite being deputy prime minister, Richard Marles's profile is much lower than that of Treasurer Jim Chalmers, the candidate considered most likely to succeed Anthony Albanese as Labor's leader.

title.children: Richard Marles plays a dead bat on nuclear as the government rushes to get through late work

image.altText: A close-up of a large, ornate wooden door at the front of Victoria's Parliament house

props.synopsis: The Victorian premier says a Memorandum of Understanding between the government and the Israeli Ministry of Defence signed in December 2022 won't be renewed As the state focuses on other "strategic opportunities".

title.children: Victorian government says agreement with Israel's defence ministry will not be renewed

image.altText: Antarctica research

props.synopsis: Hundreds of polar researchers issue an emergency statement calling for urgent action to deal with the impacts of climate change in Antarctica.

title.children: Antarctic researchers warn of possible 'catastrophic' sea level rise within our lifetime

image.altText: Three tall, modern apartment towers with a CBD skyline in the background.

props.synopsis: Apartment buildings in NSW could be inspected without a warrant and unit owners could be compelled to hand over documents under proposed new laws targeting owners corporations who do not fix common property.

title.children: 'Extraordinary intervention' into private property allowed under proposed NSW strata laws

image.altText: Rain at Augathella

props.synopsis: Parts of Queensland have marked the highest single-day November rainfall in more than 20 years, the weather bureau says.

title.children: Parts of Queensland mark highest single-day November rainfall in more than 20 years

image.altText: A grassy field near an airport

props.synopsis: Two people were in the helicopter when it came down this morning. The pilot survived and has been taken to Melbourne for treatment.

title.children: One person confirmed dead, survivor injured after helicopter crash in south-west NSW

image.altText: A composite image of a Japanese man, with a pair of rainbow socks and grey hoodie.

props.synopsis: Can clothing disrupt a fair trial? That's a question before the courts in Japan.

title.children: Cover that rainbow: Japanese lawsuit challenges the right of judges to police clothing

image.altText: Two men - one in a suit, one in a black t-shirt and pants and a black eye - stand in a dry field with a green urn.

props.synopsis: It may not feature a dance-off to 'Super Freak', but this road trip movie about a dysfunctional family features plenty of sweetness and light.

title.children: Two estranged brothers go on a road trip to scatter their mother's ashes in Strange Creatures

image.altText: A crowd of people in red hats

props.synopsis: The family of 19-year-old Isla Bell, who was allegedly killed by a man in Melbourne last month, have joined a march in the heart of the city to demand an end to violence against women.

title.children: Isla Bell's family attend anti-violence march in Melbourne

image.altText: A group of young men in AFL jerseys sit together on steps for a photo

props.synopsis: The 2024 AFL draft has been completed, with all 18 clubs adding to their lists with players they hope will be stars of the future. Here's who your club selected and what it means for your team.

title.children: How did your club fare at the AFL draft? Every team's haul analysed

image.altText: Professor Stephen Wilson

props.synopsis: Professor Stephen Wilson told a nuclear committee he had received no funding from coal companies. The committee has written to the Institute of Public Affairs fellow to ask if that's true, which he has affirmed to the ABC.

title.children: Pro-nuclear professor linked to Coalition questioned over possible coal industry funding, which he denies

image.altText: Michelle Ananda-Rajah is sitting down wearing a pale blue blazer and a multi-coloured scarf.

props.synopsis: Labor MP Michelle Ananda-Rajah will attempt to make the switch from the House to the Senate as a Victorian Labor candidate at next year's election.

title.children: With no seat to call home, this Labor MP is eyeing off an 'unlikely' switch to the Senate

image.altText: Woman holds back due to pain

props.synopsis: A former insider calls it the "side hustle" of Australia's superannuation funds – where the handling of thousands of death and disability claims from injured workers and grieving families falls to underpaid, overworked staff away from the main game.

title.children: Super fund 'side hustle' leaves workers waiting on insurance payouts

image.altText: A teenager holding a mobile phone up to hide his face

props.synopsis: Immigration law experts argue the changes could have serious implications for the rights of detainees.

title.children: Mobile phones could be confiscated from immigration detainees under new Home Affairs proposal
